intro: Connarus angustifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved connarus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, often with a slight red or purple tint. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
